creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure standing on stern of boat with PR arm outstretched in front, and a cluster of fish on a stringer in PL hand
inscription:
Label

-- in graphite on verso: PUTS | D830I

-- label on back of frame, upper center: H. Shickman Gallery, 929 Park Ave., New York, N.Y. 10028 / D830-I / 550

-- label on back of frame, lower center: Drawings and Watercolors from Minnesota Private Collections  / L71.115.1 / catalogue no. 6. STEFANO DELLA BELLA / \"Fisherman Standing on a Boat,\" c. 1630-1640 / The Minneapolis Institute of Arts May 13-June 13, 1971
provenance: [Herman Shickman Gallery, New York, at least until 1971; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Fisherman Standing in a Boat
